problem_text:
Is it true that for every finite group G and every factorization |G| = ab there exist subsets A, B ⊆ G with |A| = a and |B| = b such that G = AB? Cf. 19.35 in Archive.
Comment of 2025: any minimal counterexample G must be a simple group without prime-index subgroups (R. R. Bildanov, V. A. Goryachenko, A. V. Vasil’ev, Siberian Electron. Math. Rep., 17 (2020), 683–689; M. H. Hooshmand, Commun. Algebra, 49, no. 7 (2021), 2927–2933).
M. H. Hooshmand
